intro: Schmaltzia microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved Schmaltzia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale green, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Schmaltzia microphylla is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas.
